answers.answer: I am not a doctor, but have come across something like this before.Below is useful information for you to get your skin better.I know that you are shy and have a problem with seeing a doctor, but sorry, you do need to see one - the sooner the better.  You could also book in to see a dermatologist or ask your doctor to refer you to one.The doctor should take a swab of all the skin area that is bothering you and this would be sent to a laboratory for analysis.  The lab analysis would be able to identify the bacteria, virus and fungus that is on your skin that is causing the skin problem.  The doctor will then be able to treat your skin condition much better knowing what he was dealing with.At home, do NOT use normal soap.  Only use soap that has no perfume, one that has the same pH level as our skin and baby washes should be fine. Don't use bath or shower gels.   You can also buy from the pharmacy without a prescription an emollient that can be used instead of soap.The normal soap and the bath and shower gels will dry your skin out even more.Don't us biological washing detergents to wash your clothes.  Use non biological ones.It is highly likely that you have a very bad fungal infection and probably a bacterial one too.  The doctor would be able to prescribe antifungal medications in capsule form that you swallow.  The doctor can prescribe a stronger dose and a longer course of the antifungal than what you can purchase from the pharmacy without a prescription.  The antifungal medication that is in capsule form and is sold as a single dose is 100mg of Fluconazole.  You may be able to get a 200mg strength.  But even that may not be enough with you having such a large area of problem skin and the fact that you have had it for some time.You can also purchase from the pharmacy without a prescription an antifungal cream that is used specifically on the skin and on the genitals.You would also need a lubricating oil that will give back the moisture that is lost in your skin.  Emollin is a fine spray that is used for that purpose.  As the cream may be painful for you to apply, ask your pharmacist if he has an antifungal that comes as a spray.  In the UK Canesten is available in a little spray bottle.  You may or may not be able to get the Emollin and the Canesten spray from the pharmacy without a prescription.The doctor can also prescribe a bath solution - Dermol 600 - this is an antimicrobial solution that you pour as directed into your bath water.  It may be available with or without a prescription, you would need to ask the pharmacist.As a home remedy, after you have washed yourself with water and gently dried the skin, you can apply natural set yogurt.  You can do this for as long as you need to.  It is very cooling and draws out inflammation.  It is also a natural antifungal.Don't wear tight clothing and don't wear manmade fabrics.  Wear cotton underpants.  Manmade fabrics make you sweat more and this encourages fungal growth.Make sure that you have a healthy and well balanced diet with lots of fresh fruit and vegetables, lean meat and fish, cheese, milk, natural yogurt.  Drink plenty of fluids and especially water. 2 litres a day is usually recommended, more if you sweat a lot.Cut out or cut down on sugary, processed and junk foods.  Fungus loves sugar.   Eating natural yogurt will also help against fungal problems.Buy a big box or tub of Epsom Salts - you can purchase this from the web. Take a bath with 2 or more large cups full of the Epsom Salts dissolved in the bath water.  Put a few drops of baby oil or coconut oil - not too much otherwise you will be slipping and sliding in the bath.  You do need the oil because Epsom Salts on their own are very drying to the skin.Epsom Salts neutralises the pH level of the skin and the bacteria and fungus does not like this.  Have the baths every day until the condition starts to get better, and then decrease the baths that you take, but do shower with water every day.Epsom Salts also contains magnesium and this is absorbed through the skin.  This is a good thing.Try also applying coconut oil into the skin.  Use the virgin coconut oil.  Coconut oil is an antibacterial as well as an antifungal.  It can be used for many things and can also be used to cook with and to eat off the spoon.  It is a trans fat, so you would still need to limit the amount that you eat.  Coconut oil is the only oil that does not change its composition when heated.As you have lumps that are painful, this may be an infected cyst or boil and you would need an antibiotic for this.  If you neglect this, the infection can spread into your body and make you very ill.Your doctor should also take a blood test to check your HbA1C levels.  This is to check if you have pre diabetes or diabetes.  A glucose test would be better to check if you have glucose intolerance, pre diabetes or diabetes.Having glucose intolerance, pre diabetes or diabetes can cause these types of skin problems.You do not have anything that the doctor has not seen, so don't think about it.  Make an urgent appointment and get the appropriate medical attention and the appropriate medications.  If you do nothing, it will continue and fester and it is not very pleasant as well as being painful as you already know.Let me know how you get on.Best wishes.
